website_summaries.verdict: This rice cooker does everything you need and more – and its delay function means you can have dinner waiting at home when you open the door.
pros: Nonstick inner pot holds up to 8 cups of cooked rice
Can steam meat and vegetables while rice cooks below
Programmable digital controls with Keep-Warm, White Rice, and Brown Rice functions
Flash Rice function cuts cooking time by 50%
cons: May not cook brown rice well – try adding more water than usual

customer_reviews.title: Well, it is a year old and the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it is a year old and the plastic hook that secures the lid in the closed position just broke, therefore it doesn' close. This hood should be made of metal or of a thicker plastic. So I went to a hardware store and bought the clamp in the two pictures I post here. I screwed the clamp and seems to be quite a solid close, let's see how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: ColombianGandhi

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with this rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this rice cooker. My wife and I had a cheap rice cooker that worked for years before finally stopping. We bought this one and I don't know if we just got a lemon but the thing doesn't work. We press the button to cook, sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. For us we eat rice for breakfast. There is nothing more frustrating then waking up early, getting your rice started. Going for a walk, coming back and discovering the rice cooker has gone through its cycle and beeped to say its done but all it has done is just warm up the water a little bit! What am I supposed to eat for breakfast?! Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: japhen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month. :(
customer_reviews.text: Was terrific at first. Stopped working after 1 month. So disappointed. I wanted to purchase an item from an American company. Aroma is a good company, good reputation for quality. I have an older Aroma rice pot. It has lasted over 10 years. Decided to get a new rice pot when my Zojirushi finally died. Excited to try this new rice pot. It worked well at first. Rice was cooked perfectly. And of course, I cook rice everyday. Then, it just died. The rice stopped cooking. It keeps raw rice warm. That is it. I am so disappointed. I would love customer service to contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer2

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this rice cooker. I had a Cuisinart before that lasted for years and made perfect rice. When it finally died, I thought I would try this brand because it was rated so high. I have used it twice now and both times, even following the directions, the rice came out hard, sticky, and scorched on the bottom. I followed the directions about stirring the rice as soon as it shut off but it was already scorched on the bottom and the rice was not completely cooked. I just ordered another Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Cake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: The Aroma rice cooker is an excellent kitchen tool. Operation is fairly straight forward and provides excellent rice. One thing to watch out for is when steaming vegetables along with the rice will usually be done in about 12 minutes, however that is not the case if steaming vegetables by themselves. The rice will attenuate the steam and if you steam vegetables by themselves, the time required is less than half that time. Precise timing of the cooker is what will yield crispy vegetables and fluffy rice.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Cavazos

customer_reviews.title: Super Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This seemed very nice when we bought it, but of the 12 times I have tried using it, it has only successfully worked 2 or 3 times. It keeps ending the cooking cycle with rice that's not even cooked. Maybe it's how I'm rinsing the rice, maybe I'm doing something wrong, but it's frustrating to have tried multiple times to get this to work to no avail. I'll be looking into an alternative cooker. I was hoping this one would be good, but it's completely unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: CBooth Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in cellophane
customer_reviews.text: I feel bad for putting three stars because this could very well be an amazing appliance. My complaint though is that this thing was shipped in cellophane so you could see precisely what was on the doorstep. What really sucked is that I wanted to surprise my husband with it and he was the one that brought it inside. Oh well, it's just a rice cooker, I just thought I'd post this as a little heads up since it's the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker for the price
customer_reviews.text: I lived in the Philippines for two years and got used to having rice often. This is the third rice cooker I've owned since I moved back to the U.S. and it is, by far, my favorite. I generally eat rice 3-5x a week. This makes a fluffier, better tasting kind of rice than any other rice cooker I've used. Additionally, I appreciate the water gauge on the side of the pot and the fact that I can scoop all the rice out without it getting stuck to the pot. This doesn't burn my rice as other rice cookers have. I'll update my review if something drastically different happens, but I'm very happy with this rice cooker so far.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Morris

customer_reviews.title: Maybe 5 uses before failing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how but this product says no reviews. When i ordered it a month ago it had the most reviews out of alm the models. Anyways to the review. This thibf work as intended for less than a month. Then with no warning it stop and wont power up anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable reliability
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this rice cooker. I purchased it mostly due to the customer ratings and the price. I did not expect though that this product wouldn't even last for a month. After only a couple of weeks, in the middle of cooking rice, it beeped for a few seconds and showed E3 on display. I tried to switch it off but the power button wouldn't do anything. I unplugged it and then replugged it. I gave it another try and started on white rice cooking function. After about a couple of minutes or so, it did the same thing of long beep & E3 on display. After that episode the rice cooker has stopped working at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jog

customer_reviews.title: because it had very good reviews and was selected like best seller
customer_reviews.text: I bought it around 2 years ago the Aroma rice maker, because it had very good reviews and was selected like best seller. And now I trying to buy a new rice cooker,because the Aroma that we bought before is terrible and found again the this cooker is the best seller and has the best reviews,and I decided write my expirence. Since the beginning we had problem with it. The cooker sounds the beep to let me know cooking is complete, but when I open it I find my raw rice laying in a puddle of lukewarm water. I need to restart the cooking process and get the finished product and some time a need repeat this twice..
customer_reviews.author: octavio

customer_reviews.title: Rice made easy
customer_reviews.text: I love our new rice cooker! Always wanted one after tasting the delicious cooked rice from friends who have one. Easy instructions to follow as well. One clear cup of rice to water. The markings are easy to read on the bowl. I've tried your basic regular white rice and then a couple times added spices to jazz it up. My favorite so far is sprinkling some chicken bouillon in with the water. The warming option keeps both rice and any steam veggies on top at a good temperature. So glad I finally got this new accessory!
customer_reviews.author: Jess A

customer_reviews.title: Useless! Cooks just fine
customer_reviews.text: Useless! Cooks just fine, but should ever it drip down (and it will), it gets under the removable pot part and down into the heating element. Yes, washing rice helps, but we also like to make creamy risottos (there is a good recipe that comes with this device) and that stuff gets all over it! Impossible to clean - there is an inner lid that is removable, but sticky water and creams get everywhere, including behind the removable lid, and there are tons of nooks, crannies and crevices that make it a chore to clean. We threw it away after two uses and bought a Rival that has a simple single glass lid.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: This is such a neat little gadget. It cooks the rice perfectly both brown and white. The lid is a little difficult to clean because one piece pops off easily, the other is permanent and has holes and screws. I have yet to figure out the deep cleaning of this "upper lid" which is why I gave it a "4" rating. There is also a small plastic cup on the side that catches the moisture and is easy to lose. Overall it is a great item that makes perfect rice. It also does soups and steams vegetables. The water needs to be measured according to the instructions. Adding more water will not aid in cooking softer rice.
customer_reviews.author: Pho

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - does not cook!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried this for the first time. I put in a cup of brown rice, filled the water to the one cup line, and pushed the brown rice button. After a while it beeped and there were hard grains of uncooked rice in warm water!! The instructions are remarkably badly written so I thought I had made a mistake but when I came here to read the one star reviews lots of other people had the same problem. I guess I’ll try it one more time and then throw it in the garbage. Caveat Emptor!
customer_reviews.author: someonefewa

customer_reviews.title: there was a horrible metallic taste to it
customer_reviews.text: I made rice in this twice and each time, there was a horrible metallic taste to it. I thought it might be because it was new and thoroughly cleaned it, but ended up returning it because I didn't want it to potentially effect my health. One positive note is that I got a full refund with no problems even though I had already thrown away the original box and packaging.
customer_reviews.author: andrew chang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had one for years that finally wore out. Loved it. Bought a new one 6 months ago. It has turned off prematurely now 4 times and ruined my meals. Buy another? Probably not. Update 10/28/17: The company replaced the unit (though it took a few weeks). The new one just failed for the same reason after less than 2 months! Avoid this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not order malfunctioning in less than 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Do not order. I ordered one and started malfunctioning in less than a month. Thought it was maybe related to the one that I received and ordered a replacement. The replacement did exactly the same thing. Now, I need to stay with a rice cooker that do not work. Waste of money. They were better before, but not longer making them with the same quality. Piece of garbage. The rice cooker stopped before the rice is cooked. 😡
customer_reviews.author: J Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I have a large "family" size rice cooker I have had for over a decade and I went through several of the smaller "2-3 cup" cookers looking for something smaller. They all seemed to spit and slobber all over the counter and the cabinets. They all had set on lids. This thing is like my big cooker only smaller. Genius, huh? It never burns although I add about 20% more water when I do rice), keeps warm nicely, never drools on my counter top. Will buy again if necessary. I like it. Will recommend. Hell, I am recommending it to you right now. Buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Jhimi Island

customer_reviews.title: It broke after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this rice cooker because I could set the timer earlier in the day then come home to perfect rice at dinnertime! Unfortunately, after only a few uses, it stopped working. I tried using the timer and came home to uncooked rice. Then I tried just making the rice without using the timer and it still didn't work after several attempts. After reading the warranty, I realize that it'll cost me about the same amount in shipping there and back than if I just bought a new one. Darn.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R Dale

customer_reviews.title: This one looks nice and has more options but half the time I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan.It only works about half the time. I used to have a cheap small rice cooker with the one click button but decided to upgrade when it finally died. This one looks nice and has more options but more often than not when I try to cook rice it acts like its working but when its done I pop the lid and there's nothing but warm water and uncooked rice. I've had it a few months now and it does this at least half the time if not more. would not recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: William H

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Had to eat uncooked rice
customer_reviews.text: First off, the timer on this cooker isn’t accurate. I set the timer for one hour and the rice started to cook after 20 minutes. I let it sit for a while to see how great the warm feature was and then eventually when I go to dinner I realized rice wasn’t fully cooked. I work 9 to 5 songs hoping to get a cooker which can start cooking rice around 3 PM that way when I get back home it’s already cooked. But I guess this isn’t the cooker for me. I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nik J.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Small and efficient for college students or singles.
customer_reviews.text: Very thankful for a small rice cooker like this. I had to purchase a second one. Both my kids are in universities and I needed something for them when they don’t feel like eating cafe food. This work our perfect for my children. Will highly recommend. Please bear in mind as I see many people post negative review of how small it is. Read the product details - Cooked rice and Uncooked rice. 8 cups COOKED rice. 4 Cups UNCOOKED rice.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: NON-STICK COATING COMES OFF!
customer_reviews.text: By and large this works great for an under-$30 all in one steamer, but I've found that not only does the non-stick surface on the pot not non-stick very well at all (at least compared to my previous Zojirushi), but after about six months of use the non-stick coating is coming off with my brown rice! Hopefully I haven't been eating whatever this synthetic metallic coating is all along! What a waste - don't invest in cheap junk like this because it's just landfill fodder. I'm not even going to donate this to Goodwill because I wouldn't wish not non-stick coating on any human. Gross. Just use a stainless steel pot, or get a really nice Zojirushi.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Buckingham

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit on Jan.2 It completely stopped working 4 WEEKS LATER. It says the rice is done but when I open it it's just hard rice in lukewarm water (common problem, it seems) When I contacted amazon (after trying it once more time a few days later) they told me it was NO LONGER ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN. This was on 2/11. Barely a month after I got it. And the unit is completely defective. No idea how this is the "top rated" product on Amazon, but I will no longer be using that as a barometer for ANYTHING. I wish someone would have warned me! DO NOT BUY IT OR ANYTHING ELSE FROM THIS COMPANY!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter S Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am hoping I can add a picture later, but wanted to add my review since I realized I have totally been a slacker in regards to reviews. I purchased this rice cooker, after having to return another I had purchased first. This one works fantastic. I love the simplicity of adding the rice and water and pushing the buttons to indicate what kind of rice you’re cooking. I love that it turns it to a warm mode after it’s done cooking, and can remain in the warm mode for several hours. I haven’t tried to steam my veggies in it yet, but if I can update my review once I do, I will do so.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Element Burned Out in just 4 months of very little use
customer_reviews.text: This was the second one after the first one burned up and it was replaced. Now this one is burned out. POS! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best rice cooker for college students and people who has a small family(1-3 people)
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is so cheap and yet highly functional. It gets the job done with a price that is unbeatable. I already have a rice cooker from Aroma but it's a big one for the entire family. Since moving out, I've been wanting a rice cooker for myself and I stumble myself upon this "pro" rice cooker on SALE. A multifunctional rice cooker at $29.99 is just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser275

customer_reviews.title: Total trash- already broken the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, it warmed up the water but never even boiled. I tried the white rice and the brown rice setting and double checked I had not missed anything, but it wouldn't cook the rice. My previous Aroma rice cooker worked great, but this one is a hunk of garbage. It's too late to return it, great use of my $30.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love rice but don't make it very often because I usually burn the bottom of it. A friend had a rice cooker and it worked so well that I decided to get one. I read alot of reviews and bought this one based on what I read. The important thing for me was that it had a brown rice setting and that it wasn't too big. This fit the bill. I have made white rice and brown rice in the last week. Both turned out perfect and it is so easy. It's wonderful that you don't have to stand at the stove watching it and that it is warm and ready when you are.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA CLAYTON

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY IT!!!!! It's the worst rice cooker I have ever had. It lasted for 2 months and started to work sometimes and not work other times. Finally after 3 months of owning this rice cooker, I called Amazon to return it since it didn't let me return online any more after 3 months. It took me 50 minutes on the phone with them to just get a partial refund and a return label. Never wasted so much time on a rice cooker. Unbelievable!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fang Xia

customer_reviews.title: One of the better easy/mid-range rice cookers *UPDATED*
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The inner bowl that sores the rice is not coated well. I now have metallic black bits showing up in my rice and noticed shiny spots where the nonstick coating has come off. I use the soft side of the dish sponge and everything. Definitely something to keep an eye out for! If you're not looking to spend $70+ on an Instapot style full on powerhouse and just need basic rice and steam functions, this is the rice cooker for you. Doesn't take up too much space but makes more than enough rice for single people or small families. Lots of plastic but the durable kind that should hold up to even minor abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Makes PERFECT Jasmine Rice
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for a couple of months and I have had nothing but perfect results. I haven't used it for anything other than cooking jasmine rice for my Thai dishes, so I can't speak to those functions. But I will say it makes absolutely perfect jasmine rice. To cook rice: Use the supplied measuring cup for rice, and the water level markings for water, then push the rice button. That's it. It's truly idiot proof. The size is perfect for my family of four. If you have a larger family, or you want to cook for larger groups, you may want to consider a larger size rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Seat4F

customer_reviews.title: Dies quickly
customer_reviews.text: Rice cooker worked amazingly for the first month. Then it stopped working on the white rice setting and when it would beep that it was finished the rice would still be sitting in a pool of water. Started having to use the brown rice setting to get the rice cooked. Then that stopped. Now I have to cook the rice at least 3 times to cook it through. I would’ve returned it if I could but of course it died after the window. I absolutely do not recommend this rice cooker. Such a waste and a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Angela McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Good rice-cooker - low reliability
customer_reviews.text: Already had two of this rice-cookers. Ordered on March 20, 2016 Broken in Jan 2019. Bought a new one and got broken in April 2019. Both have same issue, stopped heating normally. Update: after reaching out to customer services, looks like that the inner pot is the weak-point as it can bend easily making the resistant to loose contact and stoop heating normally. They are sending a complementary inner pot. My first unit may have same issue and I just trowed it away. Support said that replacing the inner pot will fix most of the heating issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jumoon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cook evenly or more than 2 cups
customer_reviews.text: SO frustrating.... It's a complete lie to say that it cooks up to 8 cups of rice. It may FIT 8 cups, but it definitely won't cook it. If I try to cook any amount over 2 cups, it will leave a puddle of water and uncooked rice at the top. Seriously, even 2.5 cups, I'll only have partially cooked rice. I hate it with a passion. Which really is lame because I used to have a bigger one, and when that one finally stopped working, I decided to get the smaller model because I was never cooking a ton of rice at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Only worked 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Only worked 50% of the time. The other times it would stop cooking early. If I really needed rice I would have to babysit it so that when it gets done too soon I can restart the cooker over and over again until eventually the ricenwould be properly cooked. We don't cook rice every day so by the time we found out about the flaw it was too late to return so we just put up with it until now. We bought a different brand that is much more expensive, with a lot less features but hopefully will cook rice consistently.
customer_reviews.author: fragino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice cooker for family of 4
customer_reviews.text: I love the small compact size of this rice cooker. We typically make 2 cups of rice for our family of 4 for dinner and this cooker was so easy. Just fill the provided cup with rice 2 x, rinse the rice with warm water in the teflon coated liner, fill pan with water to the 2 cup line, plug in, press rice button. That easy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Haines

customer_reviews.title: Not working right for me.
customer_reviews.text: So I don’t know about this product. I’m really upset about it. I’ve read the instructions about 10 times. I cook brown rice. I’m doing what it says to do, and I turn it on to cook. Then when it’s done my rice isn’t done it’s hard. I don’t understand what I’m doing wrong. I tried it twice now. Second time was a little better but damn I can make the rice on the stove in 10 mins. I’m waiting a hr for this rice to cook and it’s not cooking right for me. It’s like it still raw.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Morency

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy In A Long Time
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! Came one day late but I understand with CV19 going on. This little machine is perfect for 2 to 4 people. Such a perfect size. Actually fits on my shelf without taking up too much room. I got it mainly for my brown rice because during this CV19 virus going on you can’t find the instant anywhere. And to cook the regular time was a hassle plus we’re just to lazy to cook it the regular way. But like I said it works perfect. So happy I got it. Even after CV19 subsides I’m still using this little goodie.
customer_reviews.author: rubybarboza

customer_reviews.title: I Wanted to Love this Rice Cooker, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Professional series. This rice cooker is so cute, so incredibly lightweight, perfect for two people (or more), attractive.....but I must've received a bad one. It cooked unevenly. It would be crispy on the bottom and some pockets were mushy. As everyone in Hawaii has a rice cooker, I know how to operate one; we all grow up with rice cookers. I'm so disappointed. I may purchase it again and see if I get the same problem. As usual, Amazon was great with the return/customer service.
customer_reviews.author: sanmiguel

customer_reviews.title: Life savor for college student
customer_reviews.text: Life savor as I'm a college student, I love this so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!! Have only used pressure cooker, air fry and roast so far, but perfect for all three! I was over analyzing at first, then watched a you tube once, and it is super easy. Remember to use water for one cup for pressure cooker and roast, and no water for air fry. For pressure cooker, be sure to press the little knob down, press pressure cooker, set timer and then start. Burn food goes off halfway through so you can check on it and restart it. So far i really love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: yarvet

customer_reviews.title: Great budget rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Being korean, I'm a bit of a ricephile. I normally wouldnt touch a rice cooker that under 100 dollars, becuse previous purchases of cheaper non asian name brand rice cookers never really cut it. I purchased this due to the low price point but also because of the rave reviews this cooker got. I must say, for the price, this cooker is such a great value. I wont lie and say it cooks rice better than the over $100 cookers, but you just cant beat the value compared to the quality of rice.
customer_reviews.author: daniel hong

customer_reviews.title: Makes a huge mess
customer_reviews.text: The item cooks rice great, loved using it. good texture, quick, 5 stars on that. however, it makes a HUGE HUGE mess, every time I used it there was a starchy mess all over my counter and all over the machine. Cleaning the machine is also a chore. Making oatmeal was even worse of a mess. As a counter point, it makes awesome steal cut oats. I ended up returning it. Kudos to Amazon for a great return policy, after returning the item and how easy it was, Amazon has solidified me as a lifetime Amazon buyer. Consider other rice cookers, or get great rice from this one, with the knowledge that a mess is in store for you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooker
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time last night, I was testing the water so I did 2 cups, used uncle Roger's finger method (YouTube it), and threw in some broccoli heads to steam while the drive was cooking. It cooked the rice perfectly and steamed the broccoli within an acceptable margin of error given I was not using the vegetable steamer option. I'm very happy with this rice cooker. If it dies in less than a year or has some other issue, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Vargr

customer_reviews.title: Disposable rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: At first the rice cooker worked very well. However, after using it just a short period of time, the timing function has malfunctioned. Half way through the cooking cycle, the cooker turns off! Therefore, when one goes to serve the rice it is raw. If we delay dinner and restart the cooker it makes the rice but by then the rest of the dinner is cold. I have contacted both amazon and customer service at Aroma and was disappointed with their inability to help me. If you buy this rice cooker, know that you are throwing the dice as to how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sara W.

customer_reviews.title: Total crap, don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: May cook sometimes, may not. Nothing like waiting 20 minutes and timing your dinner around the rice and they WALAH! Their ain't no nice cooked, it is sitting at the bottom of a bowl of water. It has cooked rice well twice and I've attempted to cook rice 5 times total. Looking for a new rice cooker and sending this one to the landfill. This is the second one I've purchased and they both created the same results..... Again, don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Really Great, Simple Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rice cooker and I am completely happy with it. It has performed flawlesslyy. I use it when I make just about any Asian dish. The rice always comes out perfect with just a bit of fluffing using the included fluffer tool. The unit not only works very well but it is inexpensive and useful for a host of things other than rice. I paid less than half of what my mother-in-law paid for her Japanese cooker many years ago and mine has many features that weren't available then.
customer_reviews.author: Tootie

customer_reviews.title: Messy and difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker does cook rice but it makes a huge mess in the process. Regardless of how small of a batch we make the rice cooker gets covered in this gross slimy water that then dries on. It gets all over the counters as well. It is ridiculous to clean because the lid doesn’t detach. I absolutely hate this rice cooker. Also- keep in mind that when they say it holds so many cups of rice, this is based on a cup they include that is only 3/4 of a cup.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Bean

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this product. I’m giving it 3 stars because I love how easy it is to use but if you don’t eat the rice immediately, it’s gets dried out and nasty within minutes. Wasn’t expecting that. So cooking the rice and then using the warm setting really isn’t an option. I’ve even tried adding a little extra water or some coconut oil, nope. Still dries out within minutes so if you want this for making easy rice but don’t expect to keep rice in this all day, then this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a few months then broke
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these and neither lasted more than 6 months. When they worked they were great. After a while both units just stopped heating up. I have contacted Aroma to begin a warranty claim, their agent was pleasant and offered to replace my unit - that was a couple weeks ago and I have heard anything back on my requests for tracking. I will probably not recommend these to anyone but hated enemies.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Zarling

customer_reviews.title: 3 years old and still truckin'
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever rice cooker. I am not super careful with my appliances and this thing is still wonderful after 3 years. I'd say I use it a few times a month. I've used it as a steamer but I've never tried to steam veggies while cooking rice, and I've certainly never used it for a cake like they describe. However, I hate to babysit rice on the stove and so this thing has been wonderful. Tiny footprint so it's always fit in any apartment I've lived in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glynn

customer_reviews.title: I love rice cookers
customer_reviews.text: I love rice cookers. At home I have a small 6-cup analog one, and a large 10-cup digital one that can fit a whole chicken. (Both by Aroma.) This pot is in between those two sizes, and it actually feels like an awkward compromise between the two... it's not big enough to do fancy stuff in, but it's not as simple or easy to clean as the analog 6-cup cooker. If I had to buy it again, I'd go for the 6-cup or 10-cup one instead, depending on what I want to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Saves Money and Time, Convenient, and Simple
customer_reviews.text: This thing debatably changed my life. Perfect for anyone I would assume but it's just right for a busy college student that is always out and about and either likes to stay healthy or really likes dishes with rice very often (or both). Works fine every time, typically cooks up all the rice a bit faster than the timer anticipates. Keeps rice warm for a very long time so you can have warm rice with meals multiple times per day. Saves a lot of money by letting you bulk buy rice and still cook it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Rose

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rice cooker, always just made it in a saucepan or microwave. I never felt the need for another gadget. Had dinner at a friends one night and had rice from a rice cooker. Best I ever had, so I had to have one. This small one is just perfect for me. Very simple to use, just add rice and water, select white or brown rice, and this amazing little machine cooks perfect rice and keeps it warm when it's done, every time. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 2.5 stars? I used this almost exclusively to cook brown rice. We used it once or twice to make rice cooker meals, but it's a bit small for those purposes and we have other means of cooking. It worked well for a while, but it took a good two hours today to cook my brown rice (yes, obviously I should have just cooked it on the stove at this point, but it's been a long day). I'll round up to 3 stars because of the price point, but I don't want to have to replace my appliances every 2 years, so I will probably purchase a higher end replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a few periodic uses. Turns on and the timer counts down as normal but it is not hot enough, no steam, leaving the uncooked rice sitting in a pool of water at the end of the cycle. Worked great the first few times, now it's going in the trash due to the $14 return fee..not worth risking it...if I have to spend money for a return I'm buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a staple in our kitchen at home. We are avid rice cookers, and having this cooker has saved me so much time and clean up! It cooks the rice evenly, unlike other rice cookers that I've previously purchased. We literally use this cooker almost every single day. It requires no real knowledge on cooking. You literally pour rice in, put water and press a button to start the cooking process. A bit of a pain to clean the inner rim, but still worth it considering the efficiency and the time saved. Great buy, great value!
customer_reviews.author: sgreyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Broken after not much use
customer_reviews.text: A few months after purchase the button for white rice stopped working on this rice cooker. A little over a year later when put on the brown rice setting sometimes the rice cooks and sometimes it just sits there in the water getting a little warm but not warm enough to cook. Now it just won’t cook even though you click the button and it thinks it’s cooking the rice. The timer even counts down, but uncooked rice is inside.
customer_reviews.author: Emi Rose

customer_reviews.title: Easily One of My Kitchen Staples
customer_reviews.text: This item is a staple on my counter. I cook mostly rice and oatmeal in it. I have steamed veggies a couple of times. I am pretty much use it in some fashion every day. I will be using it tonight for rice to go with my salmon. It just takes the concern out of cooking rice to perfection. I have never had a problem. I have done both brown and white rice. Jasmine rice is my favorite to cook. It smells so good when it is cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Mindymelt

customer_reviews.title: We Use This Rice Cooker ALL the Time!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to use rice cooker. We wash the rice first or there seems to be residue that sticks to the bottom of the pan if not washed. The pan comes out of the cooker for easy cleaning. There is a small back pocket for water overflow than rinses out easily. Rice seems to fall to the bottom and you can hear it in there so we shake it around once in awhile but it doesn't create any problems. Rice comes out nice in about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Tiny black particles from surface
customer_reviews.text: I am not really satisfied with my rice cooker. One of the problem is that after cooking, I see some tiny black things which stick to the rice and they are because of the surface of internal container. I really doubt about continue using it. I don't know if it is the description is clear or not. The other problem is that after cooking, steam accumulate under a layer which is related to the lid of the rice cooker and so cleaning is a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zahra

customer_reviews.title: Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a great cook, though I dap a little such as home education from my high school days. I've tried to prepare white rice like my spouse, but failed to make it right. Sometimes I could take the rice and turned them into snow balls. Sometimes, the rice was to hard, I felt like I was eating cracker jacks. But with this cooker, I followed the instructions and the white rice came out just right. Though my spouse said I'm lazy.
customer_reviews.author: loabon

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as you might think.
customer_reviews.text: It says it will make 1-10 cups of rice......but what they mean by that is 1-10 of the little cups they include with the rice cooker....NOT a regular 8 oz. cup. I measured.....8 of their cups is actually only 5 1/4 regular 8 oz. cups. SO if you think you are going to be able to make 10- 8oz. cups of rice with this cooker.....think again. The most I can cook in it is 2 cups of dry brown rice. Buy the larger size if you want to serve more than a small family.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly lady

customer_reviews.title: My favorite appliance!
customer_reviews.text: This stylish rice cooker has held up after nearly 3 years of hard use! I love my rice, and this baby works beautifully. She (after 3 years appliances develop a personality of their own) is easy to use and clean. The nonstick lining of the bowl shows no sign of wear, and the stainless steel outside shines like when I first unwrapped and laid eyes on her. She cooks my rice perfectly every time with no complaints. I would definitely recommend this rice cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Hero

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This was broken after 1 use. We ate rice from this one time. Subsequently, there was a pot of water and rice waiting for us at dinner time. I have owned another aroma rice cooker and used it weekly for years, but this one was a great disappointment. I threw it in the garbage (for $20 not wanting to deal with return/ not wanting another one as the quality is so poor)- Just bought on instant pot to replace it- THAT was an excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J. Noid

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: We have only had the rice maker since February and 1/2 of the black bottom has melted into the metal portion so cooker has to be propped up to cook. Additionally it is very hard to clean. The top portion/seal collects moisture and needs to be carefully wiped out and the top insert is hard to clean as well. The warranty requires that you pay to ship it back and include a check for $14.95 for them to send you a new one. That whole transaction amounts to as much or more as the cooker. It is a very disappointing appliance
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good rice cooker.
customer_reviews.text: It may be a benefit for people looking for a compact, lightweight rice cooker but it seems to feel too light and small compared to the other model I was replacing. The lid is a little finicky in that it doesn’t snap directly down (it can catch on the side and not close all the way). It holds a maximum of 4 cups of rice uncooked (deceiving that it is described as 8 cups cooked). Overall it looks clean. I wish the rice scooper would fit all the way in the holder so that it doesn’t stick all the way up and keep from compactly storing.
customer_reviews.author: Justin armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I've had better
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I have had this for over a year now and I use it less than the one I had before (Black & Decker). Firstly, I was disappointed because I thought the insert was stainless like my one pot). It is not. And no, it wasn't expensive but it takes FOREVER to cook rice. The 7 minute thing is AFTER it heats up and that takes like 15-20. Often it doesn't cook my brown rice completely and I have to run it a 2nd time. In side lid is a pain to clean. Not like its totally useless but its kind of unpredictable when I was hoping it would be like a mini one-pot. It's not.
customer_reviews.author: mru2

customer_reviews.title: Buy this cooker and enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful addition to my kitchen! I got this to replace an old rice cooker that I had for thirty years! I have discovered the wonders of a more current cooker! It cooks my rice the way I like it done. I use a semi brown rice and the cooker does this very well! I like the ability of the cooker to soak the rice before cooking it!
customer_reviews.author: Hele On

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker with a great price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, exactly what I expected. The reason for four stars is that it begins to slowly cake the rice to the bottom of the bowl almost immediately after it's done cooking. I just turn it off when it's done and eat room temperature rice throughout the day. I've never been a fan of steamed vegetables but this little machine does a good job. Make sure that the water is boiling before cooking your vegetables though, or you'll have green mush. ie I steam my broccoli for 3 to 4 minutes after steam starts to come out of the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Easlick

customer_reviews.title: Good rice cooker that is value priced!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great brand of an electronic rice cooker. I love that it has a mode for brown as well as white rices. You can truly walk away as this rice cooker does a much better job of keeping your cooked rice warm. My old analog Panasonic rice cooker couldn’t control as well each stage of how the rice was cooking. And it didn’t keep the rice as warm/hot if I waited more than 15 minutes to eat my meal. So this is a bonus feature of my new investment-it keeps the rice warm much longer!
customer_reviews.author: Penny S

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: By this time I've had this rice cooker for a couple weeks. I have made rice in it almost everyday for the past couple weeks. I also learned about the steam feature and i have made rice and fish at the same time a bunch of times. Getting the rice to come out properly is a little difficult while steaming food on top of the rice, but everything always come out cooked thoroughly. Setup is really easy, and cleaning everything is really easy. My only complaint is that it came out of the box dented, but that does not stop it from cooking.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Better than average
customer_reviews.text: I've used this just for rice, but so far it's produced good batches of rice. I'd say it's a bit weaker at doing brown rice than regular white rice, but not by a huge margin. Having a brown rice setting on a rice cooker at this price point, and still cooking it decently, is pretty good in my book. You'll probably want just a bit extra water for doing brown rice in this. No idea about how useful the steamer is or how soup/stew turns out in this, but just for rice it's been pleasantly good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cooking for one made easy.
customer_reviews.text: Pulled it out of the box, washed it, and made savory oatmeal topped with a poached egg right away and it turned out just dandy. I love my large size aroma, but I eat differently than the rest of my family and wanted the smaller size so I can easily make my meals separately. I'm already very happy with purchase. The smaller pot is so much easier to deal with when cooking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Mehr

customer_reviews.title: Good option for grains other than white rice
customer_reviews.text: This Aroma Rice cooker is a replacement for an ancient Breville which gave good use for many years. I've cooked white rice and brown rice in this Aroma. It gave EXCELLENT results for both: fluffy and done to perfection. I got the 2-8 cup version. It is compact with a small profile. I did not give a five star because I feel the latch mechanism is a bit flimsy and I foresee future problems with it. There is an inner lid which creates a good seal and which attaches with a plastic o-ring. This traps some of the foam created in cooking the rice. You must remove this inner lid and clean it separately.
customer_reviews.author: C.Agustinus

customer_reviews.title: What a steal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my instant pot SUCKS at being a rice cooker. It cooks so unevenly, the top will be perfect but the bottom mushy and gross. But somehow even though the bottom is mushy and gross, the bottom will be burnt and crispy. This however... works AMAZING. My rice turned out perfect, cooked perfectly even, with absolutely nothing sticking to the bottom. I finally feel complete. I mean, what kind of Asian am I if I didn’t own a rice cooker?
customer_reviews.author: EvaElizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I bought because it’s small but
customer_reviews.text: It cooks but if you leave the rice in it then few hours later it’ll be completely rock solid dried out on one side and watery on the other side. I don’t know how that happens but that’s what it is. Many people cook rice and let it sit there till next day like typical Asian myself. If you go to Asian market near your home you will find Asian rice cooker for exact same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good... for 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this we had a 4 cup $15 cheap rice cooker. We bought this one because of the added people in our family and we needed a lot more rice and we also wanted one that was a little bit nicer and would hopefully last a little bit longer. We paid $40 for this one and it ended up breaking after three months of use. Now we're back to our cheap 4cup rice cooker that is still working after 2 1/2 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Matty's Fam

customer_reviews.title: Overcooks rice, I prefer the old model
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the old model with a simple manual "cook" button and it worked great. Rice cooked for about 10 minutes and then switched to warm function. This digital cooker has a white rice setting that is set to cook for 28 minutes! That is way too long and if I want to cook rice I have to use a timer and take it out halfway through or the rice turns to mush. Not sure how they determined the cook time but it's way too long
customer_reviews.author: Lucas McLaird

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rice cooker for 1.5 years. It worked well until this week - now it keeps shutting off before the rice is cooked, which means I can't use it while I'm away from home...which was the whole purpose of having this in the first place. Now I have to keep turning it back on and checking to see when my rice will finally be done. Might as well just use the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry rice cooker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first non-glass topped rice cooker and I was worried about clean-up, but it seems to be on par with the glass lid models. It does everything 1-2 people need. One of the best features is the brown/ white option since the cooking times are considerably different. The timer feature is also great so you know what is going on! I am still curious how well the inner top portion ends up wearing after so many cycles of steam.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker -- no stick no scorch
customer_reviews.text: This is a much nicer unit than our previous unit which died, which was a Walmart unit (they carry Aroma now). The old unit had just cook and warm and always burned the bottom of the rice. This one has different time settings for white or brown rice (latter also works for barley) and has a digital display that "spins" till last 10 minutes, then clocks down. Perfect rice every time. Haven't tried the steamer thing yet. Buy this unit! Also comes in a larger model for events, catering, etc
customer_reviews.author: the truth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice every time
customer_reviews.text: I always thought having a rice cooker was just unnecessary. After all, I have been cooking rice my entire adult life. Then my daughter bought one when she moved home after college, and we got used to having it around. When she moved out, I got this one almost immediately. Love using it. Its so easy and the results are always perfect. I use a bit more water than the recipes call for, because my husband has dental issues and likes his rice softer. It's quiet, the controls are easy to read, it cleans up like a charm, and best of all, it doesn't take up a burner on your stove!
customer_reviews.author: Polly B.

customer_reviews.title: NOT CONSISTENT
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this product with its brown rice setting, but most of the time it simply does not cook the rice. The manual says it should take around 55 minutes to cook the brown rice, but usually after about 15 minutes the 10 minute countdown appears. When it chimes that the rice is ready, it is not cooked at all. I can restart the process and sometimes it will eventually cook the rice. I am looking for a better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: William Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stopped cooking after three months
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this rice maker at first. Size was fine, made rice just right. Purchased in November, 3 months ago, on at least four separate occasions the rice maker has not worked. We prepared the rice, pressed on, watch the light come on, waited the hour for it to beep, and opened the top to discover uncooked rice. At first, we thought it was operator error but after a few times now we know it’s the machine. I wish we had purchased another one, the digital display is not reassuring of cooking. Next time we’re going with a rice maker that you have to push down the button to start, we know those work.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonIsLife

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 4 months ago, and have used it countless times. It worked great, and we really liked the quality of the rice. However, it just quit this week. It acts like it is working, cooking, dings when it is finished, but the contents remain hard, wet and only warm, not hot. At this price point, not worth fighting for warranty replacement, will just buy another. From looking at reviews, we seem to have gotten a defective one. :(
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rice Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I can cook other things while the rice is going and comes out perfect every time. The only thing I don’t like is cleaning it. The starch from the rice when mixed with the steam (yes, even after rinsing there will still be starch left behind) leaves a residue on the lid if you don’t clean it right away and it can even lead to mold (I found that out the hard way). Make sure to REALLY deep-clean the lid and the rubber gasket and DRY THEM THOROUGHLY. Other than that, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: FeelingSquatchy

customer_reviews.title: Makes life better
customer_reviews.text: Automatic rice. Stop making your own and get this, trust me. The single best purchase I've ever made. Cooks perfect rice every single time. I've also made potatoes with this thing, and you can look on YouTube for a ton of recipes. Used this thing HEAVILY the past few months and it still works like new. 100% buy this and you won't regret it, unless if you don't really eat rice.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: ... rice cooker is so simple to use and makes great rice. We've made basmati
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is so simple to use and makes great rice. We've made basmati, thai and brown rice and each turn out as we'd expect. We are not rice connoisseurs just regular people cooking dinner who want rice as part of the dish. Its convenient to have the cooker off to the side making rice and not watching a pot or taking up precious space on the stove. I've noticed best results when starting with cold water. The burner gets confused if warm water is in the pot and will not heat and cook as it should.
customer_reviews.author: HrGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too much time to cook
customer_reviews.text: The rice cooker works just fine and produces proper texture rice, but it takes WAY too long to make rice. My prior rice cooker by aroma cooked in half the time. This one takes so long that I'm now looking for a new rice cooker. I was patient for 6 months, but found that I have been avoiding making dishes with rice due to the time cost.
customer_reviews.author: MediuMaintenance

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Aroma Rice Cooker more than several times. It does an excellent job in preparing nice rice. However, it does sometimes boil over. I'm not certain what causes that as I am following the directions carefully. That being said, one needs to put it where one can clean it up and also clean under it. I'd say it's a good product for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is so easy to use! it doesn't take up much cubbard space, and its so light weight that it is not a pain take in and out of cupboard! I bought this because I either A0 burn my rice on the stove or B) by the time i realize I want rice, its gonna take to long. With this, i start the rice, and you have time to prep and stir fry your veggies and meat!
customer_reviews.author: arnelsen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We own a 20 cup Aroma rice cooker for the last 10 years. Generally we were happy with the quality of the cooked rice. I decided it's time to get a new one and this 8 cup model would be a perfect fit. Boy, was I disappointed! The white rice came out under cooked on the first run. Tried again with slightly more water, same result. Also the build quality is a noticeably worse than the older model. Even though I love the compact size and light weight, I unfortunately had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: gameboy

customer_reviews.title: This was bought as a gift because I love mine that much!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have checked out several other rice cookers and the Japanese ones come in second cost-wise to the Aroma brand. I LOVE MINE and use it very often and find that for the two of us, the portion size is perfect. I also have a Cuisinart combo pressure cooker/slow cooker and always pull out the Aroma rice cooker first. It makes the perfect oatmeal, brown rice, Mexican yellow rice and soups. It is a kitchen MUST-HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Klyber

customer_reviews.title: Quick. Works great. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this! I don’t know why it took us so long to get a rice cooker. If you follow the instructions, makes the perfect sticky rice. The only thing is I wish the steamer basket was larger. It honestly will only make about one serving. So we often have to run it twice or just steam on our stove. Otherwise product is great! Super easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan & Lanae Kirby

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how much I needed a rice cooker until I bought one. This is the first rice cooker I've ever used and it is so simple! The instruction manual makes this so user friendly, only a couple steps and you're making your food. So far I've only made white rice in it, but there are lines on the inside that help you add the perfect amount of water to the amount of rice you've put in. My rice was nice and fluffy and none of it stuck to the inner bowl. I'll never make rice the old fashioned way again. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Lucio

customer_reviews.title: it works, mostly
customer_reviews.text: I have an issue with the steam collecting on the lid handle and pooling in the concave center of the lid. sometimes, if I'm not watching closely enough, enough moisture will build up that it flows down the back and makes a mess on the counter. Does a good job cooking rice but really too small to steam decent amounts of veggies. Probably best suited for steaming portions for one or two.
customer_reviews.author: The Supply Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This took a while to get my rice how I like it, but that was more a learning curve. My old rice cooker needed more water than this one does. But i love it now. I make steamed rice as well as my mexican rice in here too. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

product_meta.title: Aroma Housewares 2-8-Cups (Cooked) Digital Cool-Touch Rice Grain Cooker and Food Steamer, Stainless, 8 Cup, Silver
product_meta.description: Color:SilverLet Aroma do the Cooking for You Enjoy easy home cooking with the Aroma 8-Cup Digital Rice Cooker & Food Steamer. Restaurant-quality rice. Healthy steamed meals. Delicious one-pot dishes. Prepare all this and more at the press of a button. Aroma takes the "cook" out of home cooking - turning kitchen time into your time. Help the kids with homework, get creative at play time, or pick up that novel you've been waiting to dive into. All while delivering hot, hearty and healthy meals the entire family will love. Digital Convenience This convenient cooker's compact capacity perfectly cooks 2 to 8 cups of any variety of rice with specialized functions for both white and brown rice. Once the rice has finished, it will automatically switch to Keep-Warm so there's no need for monitoring or stirring. The Steam Tray allows for healthy steaming of meats and vegetables, even as rice cooks below. It's also suitable for oatmeal, chili, jambalaya, soups, and more. Delay Timer The Delay Timer is designed for people on the go. Place rice in the cooker in the morning, set the Delay Timer to have rice ready when it's needed and come back to perfect rice ready to serve. Plus, no matter when rice is finished, the cooker will automatically switch to Keep-Warm for conveniently flexible meal planning. So, no matter what wrenches life throws in your schedule, you'll still come home to a quality meal ready when you are. Easy Cleanup Cleaning up is never fun. When the cooking is done, the inner cooking pot and all accessories remove for easy cleanup. It is Non-stick coated
feature_bullets: Multi-functional use - cooks white and brown rice to perfection, but also jambalaya, steamed veggies, and even a fluffy cake! The possibilities are endless!!
Steaming capabilities - steam tray allows you to prepare your veggies above while rice, soup, or any other meal cooks below - allowing you to save time without sacrificing quality.
Capacity and measurements - cooks 2 to 8 cups of cooked rice. Easy to store at home - measures 8.25 x 8.5 x 9 inches.
Accessories - simple to operate using our user-friendly digital panel that switches to keep warm automatically - set it and forget it!
Contents - includes a non-stick inner pot, steamer tray, rice measuring cup, and plastic rice spatula.
Item holds up to 2 to 8 cups of cooked rice. 8 cups is the cooked rice capacity. Rice must be cooked in the cup that comes along with this product.
Steams meat and vegetables while rice cooks below
Easy-to-use, programmable digital controls with automatic Keep-Warm and White Rice and Brown Rice functions
15-hour Delay Timer for flexible meal planning
Includes steam tray, rice measuring cup, serving spatula, and exclusive recipes and coupons for Mahatma and Carolina Rice
Great for soups, jambalaya, chili, and more. Save time with the Flash Rice function which cuts cooking time by up to 50%

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars18,299 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
